creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: five lines of very small calligraphy on a tiny sheet of paper, mounted inside a circle with green and beige outer mount
inscription: 九月東籬色 / 清佳家是黄 / 南陽瓊泡酒 / 太漱鶴垂裳 / 節挟風霜烈 / 思含雨露香 / 更起坤土質 / 千歳照金寿 ] (Ninth month: the color by the eastern hedge / Is the most pure beauty of yellow. / In the setting sun, magnificent wine foams up; / With this rich drink, I can watch cranes lower their robes. / In a season caught between wind and severe frost,  / Cherishing the scent of rain and dew, / Their longevity comes from the substance of the earth –  / For a thousand years, their golden petals will shine)  (SA)
markings: Japanese inscription along edge of scroll when rolled; back R, when rolled, square relief; URC, oval relief: 明□心{Myō…shin}; LLC, square relief: 阮瑜之印{Gen’yu no in}; LLC, square relief: 白玉氏{Hakugyoku shi}
title: Ninth Month
